attributes.action: Improve allergen labelling on food packaging.
attributes.background:
8% of children and 2% of adults have one or more potentially life threatening food allergies (not intolerances), yet labelling is unclear.
Food should be labelled with:
the front of packaging should have icons to show the type of allergen*. 
The back should list all allergens separately.
attributes.additional_details:
May contains statements are currently optional - leaving people unsure if food is safe. They should be mandatory where there is a genuine risk of cross contamination. Even a small amount of allergen can be fatal.

Currently allergens are made bold in the main ingredients list. Allergy sufferers and their carers have to carefully examine the ingredients to spot them.

Sources:
https://www.anaphylaxis.org.uk/

*Icons for allergens:
http://www.erudus.com/standardised-food-allergy-icons/

attributes.action: Smart Brexit:  Apply to rejoin EFTA
attributes.background: A 'hard Brexit' is a nightmare scenario for the UK, in which jobs and trade will suffer catastrophically. However, the U.K. can maintain free trade with the EU by applying to European Free Trade Association (EFTA) Council to rejoin EFTA and regain powers to write trade deals with non EU countries.
attributes.additional_details: The EFTA countries enjoy unparalleled access to EU goods and services markets. EFTA citizens enjoy free movement across EEA/EU states. EFTA States have 27 free trade agreements, covering 38 countries including Canada, and are close to signing an FTA with India. In addition, EFTA is outside the EU foreign, justice, agriculture and fisheries policies. Overall, reductions in net cost to the UK have been estimated at between 17% and 60% of current payments.

attributes.action: Help Assist in Rejuvenating the Sacred Holy Yamuna River
attributes.background: Yamuna River (India), is worshipped by millions of devotees all around the world through pious banks of Vrindavan, Mathura and Gokul. The river has many spiritual significance to all. This very river is polluted with toxic industrial and domestic waste from Delhi and other drains.
attributes.additional_details: United Nation has declared the Yamuna River dead. There is no fresh flow, flowing through whole stretch. Devotees are forced to take a sip, bath and perform religious activities in these toxic polluted waters. We urge the UK Government to assist the Indian Government to treat their Industrial and Domestic waste and not to pour treated or untreated waste water into Yamuna River. Furthermore ensure adequate natural flow of fresh water throughout the stretch,which starts from Yamunotri to Allahabad

attributes.action: Zero hours contracts should be abolished.
attributes.background:
Zero hours contracts should be abolished to stop exploitation of the work force. They do not offer regular working hours and lead to poor working practices.
It is time Government legislated to outlaw them.

attributes.action: Sex crimes against children to receive harsher penalties and mandatory jail time
attributes.background: Paedophiles who arrange to meet children, help facilitate attacks over the internet, download child pornography or sexually abuse children are often getting very little if at all any jail time; this is not a deterrent to those who seek out our children for their own twisted needs.
attributes.additional_details: It's about time paedophiles are scared of the sentences given at court to deter them from their crimes. No crime is victimless; children are abused so others can download the pictures therefore facilitating this crime. Parents and non parents are outraged when a shoplifter can get a heavier sentence than those who destroy the souls of our children and it's about time that stopped.

attributes.action: Introduce a nationwide deposit return system for plastic bottles in the UK
attributes.background: We call for the UK-wide introduction of a deposit return scheme for drinks bottles and cans. While Scotland is planning such a scheme, the rest of the country must not fall behind. Given the near-ubiquitous plastic pollution of oceans and land environments, urgent action is required by the whole UK.
attributes.additional_details: Worldwide, 8 million tonnes of plastic leaks into the oceans annually, where it fragments into ever-smaller particles. According to scientific studies, it can now be found in the guts of 90% of seabirds, in 1/3 of UK-caught fish, and even in tap water. Urgent action is needed. Of the 35 million plastic bottles discarded daily by British households, almost half do not get recycled. Many countries already have deposit return schemes. In the German one, over 97% of PET plastic bottles get recycled.

attributes.action: Close anticlock sliproad M25 junction 1b to stop drivers cutting from junction 2
attributes.background: The anticlockwise slip road at junction 1b is used as cut through when the M25 traffic is bad. This then blocks the flow of traffic in and around Dartford resulting in major conjestion and air/noise pollution in the local area.
attributes.additional_details: The local authority have stated that they cannot install or police a box junction. If a box junction was to be installed it will likely be ignored anyway. Access to the M25 could be maintained via the junction and roundabouts at junction 2

attributes.action: Change the rules to allow gay men to donate blood more freely.
attributes.background: NHS has been crying out for people to donate more blood. Yet as a gay man I cannot do this as easily as others mainly due to the restrictions in place. Having to abstain from sex for 3 months as of 2018 is still not good enough. Gay men want to help save lives too. Help change the rules. Equality.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.blood.co.uk/who-can-give-blood/men-who-have-sex-with-men/

attributes.action: Suspend UK training the Burmese Armed Forces.
attributes.background: In 2017 the Burmese Armed Forces did something called Ethnic Cleansing to the Rohingya Muslims. Ethnic Cleansing is when they remove an ethnicity from their territory. It comes in forms like deportation and, in severe cases, mass murder and genocidal rape. Last year UK funded the Burma Army £305K.
attributes.additional_details: So far the Armed Forces have killed more than 1000 Muslims and 200,000 Muslims have been displaced from their homes and fled to other countries. They have also raped some women and have burnt people's homes. We the people paid the government so that they can make good use of it. We want them to stop funding the Burmese Armed Forces because of the actions they have done to the Muslims. Imagine if you were a 5yr old innocent child, you had fled to Bangladesh and your family had recently died. So please take action in Myanmar.

attributes.action: Abolish prescription charges
attributes.background: England is the only part of the UK who still charges prescription charges. Prescription charges make medications unaffordable. The Prescription Charges Coalition found that 1 in 3 people with a long term condition who paid for their medications did not pick up their medication due to costs.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.prescriptionchargescoalition.org.uk/uploads/1/2/7/5/12754304/still_paying_the_price_june_2017.pdf

attributes.action: Create a campaign to raise awareness of the symptoms of type 1 diabetes
attributes.background: The number of young people being diagnosed with type 1 diabetes is rising at an alarming rate. The symptoms are often missed or explained away as flu. If left undiagnosed the outcome is fatal. If diagnosis is delayed the result is life changing. We need a campaign to highlight the symptoms.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.news-medical.net/news/2007/03/19/22619.aspx

https://www.diabetes.org.uk/About_us/News_Landing_Page/UK-has-worlds-5th-highest-rate-of-Type-1-diabetes-in-children/

The statistics are frightening.
We need to raise awareness of the symptoms like we have had with meningitis and more recently sepsis.

attributes.action: Allow Martial Arts to be on the GCSE/A Level syllabus.
attributes.background: Martial arts such as judo, taekwondo and karate have been dropped from approved activities as part of the GCSE and A Level curriculum. Martial arts promote self discipline, self confidence, respect as well as an excellent way to improve all round fitness and not to mention teaching self defence.

attributes.action: When a defendant makes a plea in a sexual case, the jury should be made aware
attributes.background: Three girls were raped. When the case went to Crown Court, the rapist offered to plead guilty saying that he used his fingers and not his private part. The girls rejected the plea and, to the horror of all 13 witnesses, he was found not guilty. The jury should have known he offered a guilty plea.
attributes.additional_details: In future, when a defendant makes a plea in a case of sexual violence, the jury should be told

attributes.action: All Government forms, publications in English or English/Welsh languages only.
attributes.background:
In 2014 the public sector spent 140 million on translation services; 2017 will be considerably more.
Local councils spent at least £25m; the police £21m; the courts system spent more than £10m without accounting for the cost of legal aid; and the NHS – a conservative estimate was £55m.
attributes.additional_details:
The Human Rights Act only requires translation if someone is arrested or charged with a criminal offence.

There are far too many foreign nationals settled in the UK long term that do not or refuse to integrate fully into our society by not learning to read and write in our native languages.

Translating is not only expensive it is doing harm because it reinforces the language barrier which separates communities and hinders integration.

attributes.action: I want everybody to have the chance to have one free try of IVF on the NHS
attributes.background: I think its wrong how some people cannot have children through natural reasons but they have to pay for IVF. For example, a couple and say the man has previous children they have to pay then. This is unfair for the woman when people can get nose jobs etc on the NHS its unfair and it needs to change.

attributes.action: All high-rise tower blocks over 30 metres must have sprinklers installed.
attributes.background: Sprinklers save the lives of tower block residents and firefighters. Lives could have been saved in the fatal fires at Grenfell Tower and Lakanal House in London, and at Shirley Towers in Southampton. The new law should include a duty on local authorities and the local fire service to enforce.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2013, the Coroner of the Shirley Towers fire recommended that:
"Social housing providers should be encouraged to consider the retrofitting of sprinklers in all existing high-rise buildings in excess of 30 metres in height." Fire experts recommend sprinklers too. Yet in all this time, seven years after Shirley Towers, councils and housing providers have failed to install sprinklers. We should not wait for the Grenfell Tower investigations to complete. The law must change NOW.

attributes.action: Prevent President Buhari and all state Governors of Nigeria from entering the UK
attributes.background: Nigerian Government troops have entered SE Nigeria under Python Dance II. It's an act of provocation. The UK Government must act by banning President Buhari and all state governors of Nigeria from entering the UK.

attributes.action: Make Student Nurses and Midwives eligible for 30 hours free childcare
attributes.background: Earlier in the year, the government introduced 30 hours of free childcare for 3-4 year olds in the UK. It has since emerged that this scheme ignores the workforce of Student Nurses and Midwives with children who work 30+ hours in the NHS, who are now without a bursary and have limited support.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017, Student Nurse and Midwifery applications fell by a staggering 23% after the abolition of NHS Bursaries. These students now need to take out loans and take up second jobs in order to make ends meet. This is even harder for students with children and often forces them to drop out after the first year of training.
There are 24,000 nursing posts in the UK which need filling. This is a change that could benefit thousands of Student Nurses and Midwives, and help fill those vacancies.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that all new building developments incorporate solar panels
attributes.background: There is a requirement for alternative energy, and given the number of new houses required moving forward, this would be an ideal strategy to help alleviate the use of fossil and nuclear energy.
attributes.additional_details: It would also be easier to connect to the national grid at the build stage rather than having to retro-fit at a later stage. it would also help increase the solar power industry.

attributes.action: Make photo ID mandatory in all elections and Referenda.
attributes.background: We believe production of photo ID in all future elections and Referenda should be mandatory. There have been several examples of personation in elections. Bringing in mandatory photo ID when voting would remove this problem.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for councils to provide essential public toilets.
attributes.background: Throughout the country council are closing public toilets in cost cutting measures but these decision are unfair on certain sections of our society, especially young and disabled persons. It is a natural requirement for us all to use the toilets and facilities should be made available where needed.
attributes.additional_details: At public open spaces where public toilets have been removed this has discriminated against those who are now unable to benefit from the health and well being these open spaces provide because of their need to use the a toilet. Discriminating against any section of society is unlawful in both UK and EU law but this has not deterred councils for closing public toilets. If legislation were created then they would no longer be able to use the excuse, "We have no legal requirement to provide them"

attributes.action: Allow women to carry pepper sprays for self defence.
attributes.background:
It's unfortunate that we we are witnessing the rise of crime especially in the last year. It is also common sense to acknowledge that women are in a higher risk to be victims of all crimes especially ones of sexual nature.
As crime is skyrocketing protecting ourselves is an obligation.
attributes.additional_details: The Office of National Statistics state that the total number of crimes reported by police arose by 10% between April 2016 and March 2017 -a total of almost 5 million crimes. Violent crimes arose by 18%, robberies by 16%, sex offences by 14% and knife crimes by 20%. Women are more likely to experience all kind of violence and 5 times as likely to experience sexual attacks.The number of rapes recorded by police has doubled in the last 4 years. The figures are worrying and women feel insecure.

attributes.action: Lower the cervical smear test age to 18!
attributes.background: We want to lower the age of smear tests from 25 to 18. If we cannot lower it to 18 we should at least let girls from 18 be allowed to get a test if they so wish!
attributes.additional_details: Every 2 in 100 girls that are diagnosed are under the age of 25. If there is history in the family of cervical cancer I believe girls should be allowed to be tested and not have to wait until they are 25! Please see sense! Sign this petition so that we may help others and potentially our children or our children's children in the future!

attributes.action: Make the DNA testing of dogs compulsory in order to compile a national database
attributes.background: The DNA testing of dog mess is already offered by some companies and could be used to find a dog owner guilty of such an offence. The problem is there is no database for the DNA of dogs, and owners are not obliged by law to register them. A database would allow an unequivocal conviction to be made.

attributes.action: Cyclists must take a road test, be Licensed and Insured to be on the road.
attributes.background: In light of the recent deaths involving cyclists causing harm or even death to pedestrian or themselves, please sign this petition so that it becomes a legal requirement to undertake a road safety test so to gain license and also have insurance like every other user on the roads.

attributes.action: Use foreign aid money to help in the Caribbean.
attributes.background: It is ludicrous not to use our foreign aid budget to help in the Caribbean, let common sense prevail and quickly.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/853897/Hurricane-Irma-UK-British-overseas-territory-foreign-aid-Boris-Johnson-Theresa-May

attributes.action: Make Sanitary Wear free on prescription for girls under 16 and women on benefits
attributes.background:
sanitary wear should be made freely available to those entitled to free prescriptions, namely women on low incomes, girls under the age of 16 and homeless women
women will use on average 11,000 items in her lifetime, for those who suffer with gynaecological conditions this will be higher.
attributes.additional_details: Along with the health risks associated with not having appropriate menstrual support, it is now more frequently affecting women at work and the education of girls as many will remain at home due to the inability to purchase the necessary items.– many of these staff are on low incomes themselves – this in itself can cause financial difficulties. It is also impacting on staff in schools as they are often purchasing these items to ensure that girls do not take time out of the classroom.
attributes.creator_name: Sarah James - GMB Union BOSS group

attributes.action: Introduce an Opt-Out Electoral Register (Automatic Voter Registration Bill)
attributes.background: TalkPolitics is calling for the electoral register to be operated on an 'opt-out' basis, rather than 'opt-in'. We are calling for all UK citizens to be automatically added to the electoral register before their 18th birthday.
attributes.additional_details:
We want to;

- Ensure the 6 million people missing from the register are included,

- Save time and money by using an automatic system, similar to the National Insurance system,

- Take down an unnecessary barrier to democracy,

- Ensure everyone has a voice.

For more information on how the policy could work, read our in-depth policy analysis here: https://talk-politics.com/policy-analysis-automatic-voter-registration/

attributes.action: Give PCV licence holders category C1 licence aswell.
attributes.background: PCV holders or category D licence holders are able to drive any size bus e.g double deckers and bendy buses which can weigh in excess of 18 tonnes but cannot drive a vehicle which weighs less than half of this.
attributes.additional_details: Driving people around in a bus or coach is much more difficult than driving a small lorry half the size of the vehicles I can drive which weighs up to 7.5 tonnes. Even to drive certain vans which can weigh 4.2 tonnes cannot be done if classed as a normal van but if classed as a minibus it can be driven but the size is no different and neither are the tachograph laws.

attributes.action: Death penalty for those found guilty of plotting or committing acts of terror
attributes.background:
Society is built entirely on trust. Trust between shop keeper and customer; trust between driver and passenger; trust between worker and employer.
Humanity has, over thousands of years, developed this system of trust so that we may live in peace, together.
There are few, seeking to destroy it.

attributes.action: Continue to recognise and allow the Inbound European Au Pair program post Brexit
attributes.background: We, the undersigned and BAPAA, are greatly concerned that the UK government has not prioritised the importance of Au Pairs to the British economy during the Brexit negotiations.  Our formal representations to government ministers have been ignored and yet Au Pairs are vital to the British economy.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of hard-working parents rely on European Au pairs to enable them to juggle their work life balance.  Au Pairs receive pocket money and live as part of a family to experience British culture and family life and to learn English. This affordable program provides UK families with flexible childcare and enables young Europeans to study English and be introduced to British values at no cost to our government.  Brexit must ensure the continuation of this valuable cultural exchange programme.

attributes.action: Require the late dialysis service at Manchester Royal Infirmary to continue
attributes.background:
Keep The Late Renal Dialysis Service at Manchester Royal Infirmary to 22:30pm.
I and my fellow Renal Dialysis patients would like to continue having access to the late shift to 22:30pm.
attributes.additional_details:
The Renal Dialysis late shift (up to 22:30pm) is vital for people like me & fellow patients who work in the daytime ( I work in a high school in a very important role). 
The late shift is key to mine and my fellow patient's rotas and timetables as we have already done so much work in the background to accommodate the Renal 
Dialysis treatment that happens every week in our lives. 

We also need to live normal lives as much as anyone. We shouldn’t save money over care.

attributes.action: Equalise survivor benefits for widows & widowers in the Teachers Pension Scheme.
attributes.background: The Teachers Pension Scheme provides survivor benefits for the spouses of teachers who have paid into the occupational pension scheme. However, there is a difference in what a teacher's widow or widower receives. A man's widow will get 50% of his pension, but a woman's widower is likely to get less.
attributes.additional_details: Historically, men and women teachers have paid exactly the same contributions into the pension scheme, and will receive equal pensions (based on their years of service and salary level). The scheme provides for their surviving partners to receive 50% of their pension. However, for the purposes of calculating these survivors benefits, male teachers leaving a widow have all their years of service from 1972 included. Female teachers (and same-sex couples) have all service prior to 1988 disregarded.

attributes.action: Make FCO Consular Services statutory, defined and guaranteed
attributes.background: FCO Consular Service is subject to abuse and discrimination. British nationals abroad cannot rely upon the published FCO Customer Charter, as it has an enormous caveat; all help is discretionary, not statutory. British nationals currently have no recourse against the FCO for failing to help them.
attributes.additional_details: Cases prove that one British national will receive consular service while another does not for the exact same needs. The Gillian Gibbons Sudan case proved that the FCO will intervene significantly more the less important the country. Brexit especially requires that the FCO publish a charter that they will honour for each and every British citizen abroad irrespective of the country involved. Also that the FCO is more proactive in cases of civil and human rights abuse.

attributes.action: Introduce a 20% cap on national media ownership.
attributes.background:
TalkPolitics is calling for an end to monopolies on media ownership. Over 50% of national UK papers sold, are controlled by two billionaires. 

We're calling for stricter regulations, that limit the amount of national media that can be owned by one person/company to 20%.
attributes.additional_details:
We want to;

- Make the Media Market truly free and competitive,
- Create a defence against abuse of market power,
- Ensure a free press rather than one controlled by media moguls,
- Protect against corporate greed in a market essential to democracy.

For more information about how this policy could work, read our in-depth policy analysis here: https://talk-politics.com/policy-analysis-20-cap-on-national-media-ownership/

attributes.action: Outlaw the excessive noise levels that are associated with fireworks.
attributes.background: The explosions that are part of many firework displays are uncomfortably loud to humans and are very often terrifying to animals who suffer as a result.The bangs are not a necessary part of the display and the spectacle would not suffer if loud bangs were not part of it.

attributes.action: To install defibrillator into all workplaces with 5 or more employees.
attributes.background:
I train first aid courses as my job and when I tell people that there is no definitive law about defibrillators in the workplace all I get is "why not? they would save more lives".

Within the UK sudden cardiac arrest (SCA) is one of the leading causes of premature death.
attributes.additional_details:
Electrical defibrillation is well established as an effective treatment for sudden cardiac arrest, and, if defibrillation is delivered within 3-5 minutes, survival rates can be as high as 50-70%.

The H&S (first aid) Regs 1981 states:
First aid provision must be ‘adequate and appropriate in the circumstances’. 

This to some employers is just a first aider and a first aid kit and I feel this is not enough, so I want to do more into making sure someone has the best chance of survival in an emergency.

attributes.action: Allow same sex couples to both be on a birth certificate without being married
attributes.background: My partner and I are in a same-sex relationship and we wanted to have a baby. We couldn't afford private IVF and didn't want to use the NHS money when we could do it ourselves at home using a sperm donor. Baby born, now my partner isn't allowed on birth certificate because we weren't married.
attributes.additional_details: Because we didn't use a private clinic or the NHS and we weren't married at the time of conception my partner is unable to go on the birth certificate. She is now having to adopt our baby to get step parent rights instead of full parental rights, which is emotionally costly as well as financially. It now leaves our daughter's future uncertain should anything happen to me. In this day and age a birth certificate should state name of parents instead of gender specification.

attributes.action: UK Government to pass a law requiring Vets to scan all newly registered animals.
attributes.background:
In March this year my British Shorthair Tabby disappeared.  Extensive searches were made contacting all organisations. On targetting Veterinary Surgeries not all were routinely scanning newly registered cats and dogs which was concerning.
I want any suspected thefts to be reported to the Police.
attributes.additional_details: Subsequently another two similar profile cats have disappeared within 0.5miles of my rural community. While these incidents have been reported to local Police their hands are tied and limited with what they can actually do. This loophole allows unscrupulous thieves to identify themselves as the owners thus depriving the true owners of their treasured pets. Kennel Club figures for 2014 show 70,000 animals missing/stolen and Direct Line figures for 2015/16 show cat theft up by 40% and the true numbers of thefts nearer 360,000. Only 10% of cats were retrieved by microchip which in large part is due to the inconsistency of scanning newly registered animals.

attributes.action: Change the NHS 24 week revival rule
attributes.background: Currently doctors and hospital staff are under no legal obligation to help babies born before 24 weeks gestation, even though the youmgest baby to be born and survive was born at just 21 weeks.  Sign to give more babies a chance to survive and live full lives.
attributes.additional_details: 4 years ago my son was born at 20 weeks gestation, he was born alive and fought for his life for 2 hours before taking his last breath, he was given absolutley no medical help, and was just left in a cot to die because of this rule. I'm sure there are many more cases like mine, and there shouldnt be any more! The bottom line of a hospitals job is to keep people alive when they enter it that way, and premature babies are no different, if they are born alive they should be helped to stay alive!

attributes.action: Eradicate the loophole that allows railway stations to be closed by stealth
attributes.background: Closure of a railway station is a serious blow to the community it serves. It deprives it of valuable transport links, and makes it much more difficult to get to and from. However, all over the country stations are being "closed by stealth" with little or any consultation of the people affected.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent example: Pilning (S Glos) - Footbridge to one platform demolished, sneaked through under the guise of a "minor modification". Now served by two trains a week in one direction only. 

We ask the Secretary of State for Transport to take the necessary steps to stop this cynical abuse of the system. Please remove the loophole that allows to close any part of a station without a proper public consultation. Make a full consultation compulsory when the change affects any passenger services.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 16
attributes.background: The voting age should be lowered to 16 because I think that people are responsible enough to know what they are voting for and they are deciding their future. 16 year olds are eligible to enlist in the army but are not allowed to vote for who makes the decisions that change their future.

attributes.action: Rescind Donald Trump's state visit invitation.
attributes.background: After Donald Trump was invited to make a state visit to the UK he used a terrorist attack in London to make political capital and to undermine the Mayor of London's response to that attack. The UK government should make its displeasure clear by rescinding his state visit invitation.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been other examples of Donald Trump's actions since the invitation was issued that show he does not deserve this honour:

- He said that there were "many fine people" participating in a neo-nazi / white supremacist rally.
- He equated the actions of those at the rally with the people protesting it.
- He declared transgender people unfit to serve in armed forces in any capacity.

The UK government should demonstrate a break from these values by rescinding the state visit invitation.

attributes.action: Change the Postal Voting rules to prevent voter fraud
attributes.background: At the moment anyone can apply for a postal vote. The Government should change the way postal votes are allowed. Only people who are seriously ill or out of the country on holiday or business should be allowed to have them.
attributes.additional_details: Postal Votes are open to widespread abuse. The Government should change the rules to prevent systemic postal vote abuse.

attributes.action: UK citizens should have the right to carry guns for self-defense
attributes.background: Given the current state of affairs in this country, people should be able to defend themselves and their families from terrorist and other criminal entities
attributes.additional_details: Enough is enough the terrorist has weapons why should people in this country live in the fear of being murdered in our own towns. If we are to be expected to live alongside people that want to kill us we should have the right to defend ourselves. Obviously, some kind of background checking system must be put in place if this is to work

attributes.action: Halve Tuition Fees, & bring back Maintenance Grants for all University students.
attributes.background: Universities are institutions of education, where students across the UK develop knowledge and skills. Yet, over recent years, the fees have been dramatically increased for reasons no Minister can explain. Each year, thousands of students fail to apply due to the cost. These fees must be reduced.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, if a UK student wishes to study at ANY university, for ANY course, they must pay £9,250 a YEAR, over their course length. Additionally, all students have a maintenance loan, which again, needs to be repaid. This eventually leaves many students with a debt of around £51,000 at the age of 21. This means that as soon as they enter work, that debt needs repaying. This petition would decrease student debt from around £51,000 over a lifetime to around £13,800, which is a vast improvement.

attributes.action: When we have any election include a selection for “None of the above”.
attributes.background:
This would allow me to register my vote as none of the candidates represent me in my constituency. 

This would also give the public a way to show no confidence in the current sitting representative as opposed to voting for a candidate that I do not believe in.
attributes.additional_details: The only evidence I can put forward is the large numbers that do not vote.

attributes.action: Make self defence classes compulsory in schools.
attributes.background: With the rising rates of brutal and savage knife crimes, muggings and terror attacks in the UK, it is vital we begin educating the new generation on how to protect and defend themselves in panic situations.
attributes.additional_details:
An average of 65 people die from knife crime in the UK every year.
Pepper spray is banned in the UK, as are other self defence weapons. 
2017 has seen the biggest rise in terror attacks.

attributes.action: Create a devolved Yorkshire Assembly with powers equal to the Welsh Assembly
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to create a devolved legislative and executive body representing the traditional county of Yorkshire which will have powers equal to that of the Welsh Assembly, overseeing local matters such as housing; the environment; health services and flood defences.

attributes.action: Abolish universal credit return to old system!
attributes.background: New universal credit replaces JSA, income support, ESA, Housing benefit, Tax credits and working tax credits. Government says universal credit will make work pay. This is rubbish. Universal credit is about cutting the social security bill meaning millions will be worse off.
attributes.additional_details: Once fully implemented will mean easier sanctioning forcing people to live on nothing. Housing subsidy will be time limited forcing more to be homeless. Support for childcare will be drastically cut. Disability element's cut or abolished altogether. Some rates are much lower than current benefit rates. Government has so far wasted hundreds of millions. They will save billions taking from the needy and most vulnerable in our society. This is a war against the poor. Whilst they prop up the rich!
